Title: Marketing Analytics Manager
RoleDescription:
Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa. Our goal at Visa is to be the most creative and impactful data-led marketer in the world. We are on a journey to develop our data, capabilities, and agency ecosystem to bring more effective and efficient business results to Visa. As part of this journey, we are building best-in-class solutions, capabilities, organization, and processes in support of marketing.As a senior data scientist within Global Insights & Analytics, you will be responsible for Visas product and marketing data, insights, and analysis ecosystem. You will use data sourced from Visas internal systems, CRM systems, and from native systems of other marketing channels such as email, digital, social, search, programmatic, partners, and events. You will contribute to insight extraction and data visualization work streams that will be shared across Visas marketing and product organizations at all levels and geographies. You will work closely with technology teams to transform business and data insight delivery and integration to a new level, improving the marketing organizations ability to track and optimize performance. A successful candidate will have experience evaluating media campaign performance and driving actionable insights to help influence later initiatives.Most of your time will be spent assisting the analytics team on driving dashboard updates and organizing task timelines, along with the opportunity to plug into campaign planning and execution life cycle. You will be working on analysis and diagnosis of marketing performance. You will monitor trends in KPIs and performance drivers and translate those data into actionable insights and recommendations. You will work closely with the marketing team to increase understanding of what works and what does not work in Visas marketing, with a strong point of view on how strategies should evolve going forward.Essential FunctionsYou will support performance reporting and marketing intelligence for the marketing organization. You will bring consistency to reporting by leading rigorous data processes to aid in the automation of KPI reporting, dashboards, and other ad hoc reports.You will focus on improving operational excellence through identification and execution of initiatives that create efficiency, remove obstacles, and improve existing processes.You will stay abreast of best practices in B2C/B2B marketing and new applications. You will advise on the ideal ways and hacks to track and measure campaign performance.You will act as an agency point on contact to ensure seamless and timely media data collection and reporting.You will collect Visa internal and industry benchmarks to add context to analysis.We are looking for a candidate who is passionate about using data to help drive decisions within a high growth / global marketing team.
Basic
 2-4 years of work experience with a bachelors degree or at least 1 year of work experience with an Advanced degree (e.g., Masters, MBA)
 You have prior experience working in marketing analytics with a track record of success.
 1-2 years of experience using SQL/Hive etc. with large data sets to support analysis
 1-2 years of experience working with reporting tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Datorama, Google DataStudio etc.
 Superb organization skills and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Preferred
 4+ years of work experience with a bachelors degree or 2+ years of relevant experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g., Masters, MBA)
 Experience analyzing data related to marketing activities such as content creation, events such as trade shows & conferences, Webinars, partner led marketing, CRM through email, media campaigns etc.
 Prior media activation / advertising experience (social and digital), preferably within the B2B space or product marketing data management and analytics experience
 Strong business acumen and strategic mindset
 Strong collaboration and communication skills  demonstrating the ability to partner effectively with different business partners, both internally (i.e., Regions, Product Org) and externally (i.e., Agency Partners).

Title: Manager - Deal Finance
RoleDescription: Visa is seeking a Manager - Global CMS Deals, to support the growth of Visas Commercial and Money Movement Solutions (CMS) business. Title: Product Manager - Payments
RoleDescription:
Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive. When partnering with Visa, you are also in a way part of a culture of purpose and belonging  where the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world  helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement. This role will be part of the Visa Direct team. The Role The Product Manager is responsible for maximizing the value of our products and the work of the engineering teams that are working on the Visa Direct platform. As part of an agile team, they work directly with an engineering team and delivery manager. They are accountable for answering the questions: What products and features should we build and why, and how do we deliver these to market? This role reports to a Product Director or Group Product Manager.  Responsibilities Strategy and Vision: Collaborate in crafting your tribes strategy by doing deep market, customer, competitor and technology research. Develop a product strategy and roadmap for your team based on company strategy, tribe strategy, deep market, customer, competitor and technology research. Secure buy-in for the product strategy from colleagues and stakeholders. Translate the strategy and the customer problems into the product backlog for your team. Discovery: Conduct discovery with clients to uncover potential problems and opportunities to tackle.  Engage with customers and colleagues to ideate new features and products to be developed. Complete detailed discovery on things like payment flows, bank or operational flows and systems maps Work with internal & external teams to develop and maintain technical documentation Ensure requirements are detailed enough to take into sprint, including functional & non-functional requirements Delivery: Manage end-to-end product development, from planning to execution and launch. Prioritize the product backlog based on customer, commercial, and strategic value, potentially across more than one scrum team Collaborate with the agile delivery manager on how the team is performing and how to improve the delivery performance.  Participate in agile ceremonies and support the team by providing details on what is being prioritised and why. Adoption: Collaborate with the Product Marketing and GTM teams to define the go-to-market approach and product positioning. Drive product adoption across various regions, segments, and use cases. Measure and communicate product performance and impact post-launch.  What Success Looks Like Delivery of product strategy, backlog, roadmap, and business cases. High-velocity shipping of new features and products that solve customer problems and generate value. Consistent delivery and detailed understanding of product development. This is a hybrid position.
